column4: hi, does anybody know where are the Window Manager Configuration Files in Ubuntu??
Hi, does anybody know where are the Window Manager Configuration files in Ubuntu?
new or old E?
oh old E
you can play new one with the E live cd dist its deb on the backend
its also an installer
its tne newer E anyway
if you've got a pre-established system tweaked it won't be helpful
unless you've setup skel correctly and can dump a packagelist to transfer over (ie have reinstall infos/stuffs setup for transfer)
then you'd need a reinstall obviously and it wouldn't be ubuntu =P
ty
they seem very kdeish in the fact theres a billion customizations you can do
i just wanted to test it since my supervisor recommended it
but i'm thinking about using SuSE now...
do you have much nix exposure?
I don't know what do you mean with nix exposure... I'm not a native-english speaker :P
about 4 years but just as a normal user... I'm a developer and used to be with doors... but now I'm beggining serious work...
ah cool sounds like you have a fun job
you don't normally find supervisors telling people to install a linux dist
my supervisor is great, although he uses MacOS, but i don't have enough cash for a mac... matter of fact just got a new pc...
yeah macs can be pricey and they can be annoying if you don't like the ui but if you can get past that they're nice (and the lack of docs)
maybe in some years i'll use mac... aint know yet...
I'll probably get one too since you can run linux and osx on them now although they're definately too pricey
hope they get cheaper... Here in Mexico most people can't even afford to have a PC...
